storyInfo: As the Sarkaz troops withdraw, Catastrophe clouds appear over the capitals of all the Core nations. Amiya stops a fleet that tries to intercept the retreating Sarkaz, and Laterano's main server delivers a revelation about the future.

attributes.content: <p=1>Lifebone</><p=2>October 1098, during the retreat of the Sarkaz forces</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Hoederer, I've brought along everyone who agreed to use the bones to retreat.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Most of them wouldn't be able to withstand the long journey—the old, the young, and more injured Sarkaz than you can count.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: W said, and I quote, 'Let them die if they want,' but the other members of her squad carried them here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Somehow, she still has quite a few living subordinates—enough to maintain order within the Lifebone and watch over Ulšulah in captivity.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So at least you won't have to worry about having no one to take the wheel if you accidentally die on the road.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Got it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What are you waiting for?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Lifebone casts a shadow over the ruins of the battlefield.
None of the Sarkaz raise their heads. They may already know of—or have grown accustomed to—the greater shadow that will soon envelop their kilometers-long procession.
Most of them move slowly as they cross the trenches left behind by the high-speed battleships.
I was just thinking... Look how long the line of soldiers is.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We've all traveled that road from Kazdel to Victoria before. We all know how long it is.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But if the Victorians break their word and open fire on the retreating Sarkaz forces, there'll be nothing you can do about it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Yes. That's how it's always been.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Maybe not immediately, but after the signal we send to all of Terra, every nation will be forced to respond.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Are you sure that will work?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Such a blatant retreat back to Kazdel will probably cause many countries to panic.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But there really is no better way.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Our squad must continue to present the strongest possible front to all factions. The moment we lose the strength to wield our weapons, we'll be devoured without a trace.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The same goes for the new 'King of Sarkaz'.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We must seize the initiative here.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The airship in the distance is faintly visible through the bones, and the ship's cannons remain locked in targeting mode.
A massive Catastrophe cloud still hovers around the ship, following the Sarkaz forces as they retreat.
But there's something else that's got me very worried.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Are you sure it's a good idea to have W guard Manfred?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's the best for the job.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The squad has reached its destination.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: The weather is clear, and visibility is good.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Keep looking to the southeast.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: We've received the latest intelligence from the Ministry of Defense, which includes Kazdel's approximate coordinates.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Please closely monitor the Sarkaz army, to ensure their retreat home isn't a cover for another military maneuver.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: The officer does not, in fact, understand why he needs to monitor the Sarkaz.
However, out of respect for his comrades, he sits in the reconnaissance vehicle and stares intently at the data being sent back by the drones.
All is calm.
There's nothing unusual to report at the moment, sir. By the way—and I'm just making small talk—Maylander rarely sends someone of your status to liaise with the military.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Heh, the Victorians think they've done a fine job covering up the disaster in Londinium.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Maylander needs to investigate the situation before we have a talk with them.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: ...Lieutenant! Lieutenant!
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: You are to report any new developments immediately!
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Of course, sir. There's nothing to report right now.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Nothing at all?!
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Wait. What's that...?
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: The officer puts down the communicator. The Catastrophe detection system on the vehicle is blaring an alarm.
He looks toward the capital district, but at this distance, he can barely make out the outline of the nomadic city.
But he can clearly see the massive shadow cast by the Catastrophe cloud, stretching from above the capital district all the way to where he stands.
Yes. He knows you are familiar with the people of Siracusa, so he hopes you'll have a chance to display your talents this time.
attributes.name: Respectful Attendant

attributes.content: Not to worry. The Sarkaz hordes are a chaotic, calamitous force, but they are ultimately mercenaries.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: We are now well aware that our neighbor, Victoria, has failed to keep them on a tight leash.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: But I shall not allow such filth to disrupt Leithanien's glorious Güldenesgesatz. Of this I am quite certain.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Please send this message along to your master—
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: The noble is interrupted by a suddenly darkening sky.
...What's going on?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Come inside with me now, sir! It's a Catastrophe!
attributes.name: Respectful Attendant

attributes.content: Contact the base for further orders... Damn! We've got no signal! What the hell is going on? Push the fleet forward. Full throttle!
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Wait—
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: The data from the Catastrophe detection system sends a chill down his spine.
The cloud has stopped expanding, just as suddenly as it had appeared a few minutes ago.
The strong wind blows Originium dust up into the sky, but it doesn't fall back down.
Then the cloud starts to dissipate as the sunlight peaks through.
Can you hear me, lieutenant?
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Yes, sir! The Catastrophe cloud appeared out of nowhere. There were no signs at all before it happened...
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Of course, of course. This was meant as a display, a show of force to intimidate us.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: You think the Sarkaz troops did this...?!
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: Maylander no longer requires your help with our investigation. Please withdraw at once. Of course, do not disclose any information about our cooperation.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: ...Yes sir.
attributes.name: Columbian Military Officer

attributes.content: May Terra bless us.
attributes.name: Voice from the Communicator

attributes.content: Enough. Deactivate the tip line. We have more than enough eyewitness accounts of the Catastrophe cloud!
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Editor-in-Chief

attributes.content: Everyone saw what happened. Those of us living in the high rises got an even closer look!
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Editor-in-Chief

attributes.content: For now, I need all of you to come up with explanations and file your stories. Everyone writes a report—whether you explain it away as an advertising hologram or new Arts from Leithanien, that's up to you.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Editor-in-Chief

attributes.content: ...Do you need anything else?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Editor-in-Chief

attributes.content: Sir, this call wasn't from a citizen...
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Staff Member

attributes.content: We just received word from our Messengers... Zwillingstürme, Laterano, Montelupe... Catastrophe clouds have appeared over the capitals of every nation.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Staff Member

attributes.content: What about Deity Grypherburg and Max D.C.?
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Editor-in-Chief

attributes.content: ...Same situation.
attributes.name: Kazimierzian Staff Member

attributes.content: That little 'Amnannam' thingamajig is pretty handy. It can send a Catastrophe to someone's doorstep before you can blink.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Tch, no wonder Doctor and the hag were so nervous when we came to take it away, and the little bunny insisted on tagging along to keep an eye on me.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Hmm...What if we just, like, destroyed every capital of the Core all at once?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: While it may indeed be able to rain down disaster on those nations, that doesn't mean it can destroy them.
I have no doubt that doing so would bring nothing but retaliation against Kazdel. Our history has repeatedly proven this, even from the earliest records.
It would be unwise, Wiš'adel. In fact, you must use Amnannam sparingly—the strain it places on the mind and body is even greater than I imagined.
You just experienced that pain firsthand.
You don't get to tell me that, Manfred.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Amnannam's potential extends far beyond intimidation, assuming we figure out the proper use for it.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Their Highnesses had much higher hopes for it. Yes, it is a weapon, a deterrent, but more importantly, it is the means by which we will break free from our destiny—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You know, you're even more annoying than Hoederer.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Don't forget who you are, dude. You're a prisoner, and we're only keeping you alive 'cause Kazdel needs you alive.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Hell, the only reason we let the Military Commission stick around is that the surviving Sarkaz still need something to believe in on the way home.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Fucking Theresis sure thought of everything, huh?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: ...I'm guessing Hoederer saw this coming long ago too, didn't he?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This was always the Regent's overt strategy: to reunite a people—brought together once more by hatred—around Kazdel—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Even Babel and the Military Commission are working together again, united toward a common goal.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yeah yeah, but don't expect to wriggle your way out of this one, Manfred. Remember what I said.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'adel...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: What, still got more to say?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: If, someday, Kazdel really does normalize its relations with the other nations, just as Her Highness Theresa once strived for...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Then I, along with the rest of the Military Commission, will have to draw a clear line between ourselves and Kazdel.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: As the Sarkaz see it, outbloods bring only pain and hatred, just as we do to them.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Sooner or later, they will claim that we haven't paid for the crimes we have committed, and on that day I will be waiting for those hateful avengers to find us—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Just shut up already. Stop acting like you're a saint or whatever.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Theresis and the rest of you assholes screwed up big time. You were so goddamned stupid I wish I could blow you to pieces right now.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Don't forget: almost all the lunatics who actually believed in your plan died in Londinium, along with the Nachzehrer.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You killed them with your own hands. There were hardly any left to even evacuate.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: But the Sarkaz will pay for their own mistakes.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Babel's not so spineless as to cast the entire Commission from the city just because a few dumbasses were bold enough to provoke Kazdel.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Her Highness would never do that, and neither will I.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: If they're stupid enough to come, I don't mind giving 'em a fight.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: But if you keep talking shit, I'll just toss you over to someone who's willing to put up with your crap.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You're not afraid of it?
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Look at that moving Catastrophe cloud over there. It seems so far away, but I can't shake the feeling it might suddenly appear right above my head...
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Of course I'm afraid. Who isn't afraid of Catastrophes?
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: But there's a trick I picked up in Sami: whenever I'm scared, I just pull my hat over my head, crouch down, and think of something happy. The things you're afraid of will disappear before you even know it.
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: After all, I'm just minding my own business—they wouldn't give me a hard time for no reason, would they?
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: Just last week you said you'd lost count of how many times you'd been captured and interrogated by one of the Famiglie.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: *sigh* I'm sorry for the trouble.
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: But misunderstandings always get cleared up in the end. I mean, you guys did let me go, didn't you?
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: ...I really can't figure out how you managed to make it all the way through Sami and Ursus in one piece. You ain't lying about that too, are ya?
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: I just happen to come across perfectly reasonable people like you all the time.
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: Hmph. Try reason your way out of Catastrophes, then.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Remind me again where you're going? Some place called 'Black Flow'?
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Yes, and I'm also going home, friend, back home to Bolívar.
attributes.name: Mysterious Man

attributes.content: That's one long-ass journey. An extra day or two won't make a difference. Besides, that tattered paper talisman you're carrying ain't gonna expire.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Anyhow, I advise you to wait for that parade of crazies to pass. They started a war; they can destroy cities.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Or maybe wait for someone or something else to test out the Catastrophe for you.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Just some friendly advice.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Those devils are bold as hell—someone's bound to try and take a bite out of 'em sooner or later.
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: He can hear the terrifying roar of the Catastrophe cloud off in the distance, along with the faint rumble of battleship engines.
The Siracusan is right. It may be wiser not to get involved in this, however...
Paryaqaqa, you ain't actually... fascinated by that cloud, are ya?
attributes.name: Siracusan Mafioso

attributes.content: Maybe I am. I find it hard to hide my excitement whenever I encounter something I've never seen before.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: True, I paid a price for it back in Sami, but I just can't get rid of this bad habit.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: To be more precise, I want to take a look at the people walking beneath the Catastrophe cloud.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: How is it going? I hope no one is giving you any trouble.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Just another ordinary funeral.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: ...A funeral beneath a Catastrophe cloud is hardly ordinary. It's unfair to so many—they should have been able to return to Kazdel with us.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Death is the one form of equality most readily attainable to all, Misery.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The vast majority of the deceased have no relatives, nor even names.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: When I asked them to leave their final words, they could not even identify anyone who might remember them after they were gone.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I shrouded the burial site in mist to keep beasts away. Unfortunately, most of the dead were still unable to return to the furnace at home as they wished.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos, do you know what lies a little further up ahead?
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: My previous missions... rarely required me to come this way.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Laterano is just south of here, not far.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: When Outcast and I went on missions together in this area, she'd often bring me here to drink.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: We once made a foolish bet—that I'd find a way to sneak in and try Lateran ice cream.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Well, I did it. No one caught me.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: But I never got the chance to tell her.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Ha. At least I'm not the one breaking my promise this time.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: So you deliberately refused the order to return to the ship with Ascalon.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You knew we'd pass through here during the retreat.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Don't try to guess my intentions, Logos.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: With Ascalon here, we'll have no issues escorting our fallen comrades and their tokens back to the ship.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Besides... she also needs some time to herself. To say goodbye to the past.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: I tried speaking to her about the retreat, but she remained silent.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Perhaps she won't have anything to say about what happens next, either.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: She witnessed the end of an era, Logos. It couldn't have been easy for her, and I fear we'll have one less participant at our future meetings.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Misery lets out another sigh.
No one can say for sure what will happen next.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: It's just like the Catastrophe cloud above our heads... I may not like this plan, but I must admit it's the best deterrent we have against those who wish to seize the chance to declare war on the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Without a strong measure like that to avoid war, there would only be more unnecessary sacrifices on the road back to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Violence is a means, never an end. There is nothing wrong with that.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Maybe I'm just a pessimist...
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: But I still think the rain will come down, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Uh-huh. So can you let me go?
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: Who the hell are you, anyway?
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: I'm really just an explorer.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: What kinda explorer could stop the lightning in a Catastrophe cloud? I-It's like the thunderbolts themselves are afraid of you...
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: Maybe they've taken a liking to me?
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: See? A few of them just landed right next to me!
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: You do realize that just makes you even more suspicious, right?
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: Personally, I think the Catastrophe's sending a clear message—don't come near us, and don't try and test us!
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: Now now, let's not be hasty. I just wanted to study the strange Catastrophe cloud you created, as well as remind you that—
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: I don't like you.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: You tell too many lies.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: The Sarkaz mercenary sizes up the man standing before him, and hesitates about whether to make a move.
This guy's the one you were talking about?
He looks pretty normal to me.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You sure you got this right, old geezer?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: He is giving off a particular scent, one I loathe.
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: (Ancient Sarkaz language) 'Šmal'deqa'... 'enemies from outside'.
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: No... It is not coming from him, it is what he brought with him.
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: Strange. It seems to be... a piece of paper?
attributes.name: Revenant's Voice

attributes.content: Pfft. You really are confused, you old coot.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: So does this mean we don't need to worry about him anymore? Hey! Why aren't you saying anything?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Boss, I—
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: I told you, call me 'Chairman' from now on. Tch, what a pain in the ass. Why did Hoederer have to make up all these stupid rules?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Only Her Highness should be called 'Chairman'...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Anyway, your squad's out here to scout, so just keep on scouting. Leave this guy to me.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: You. If you've got something to say, say it. Don't try and pull a fast one on me.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I guarantee I'm faster than you.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: There's a fleet heading your way. Don't know which nation they're from—they've disabled all identifying signals.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: They're coming from that direction. The terrain provides a lot of cover. It would be easy to plan an ambush.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: I guess everyone wants in on this.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Tch, what a bunch of cowards. Afraid of us, yet always acting cocky.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel
Wiš'adel
attributes.content: Alright, I'll pass on the word to the guys charging to their deaths on the frontlines

attributes.name: Wiš'adel
attributes.content: —Hello? Can you hear me? While you're out there, watch out for an ambush.
attributes.joined: Alright, I'll pass on the word to the guys charging to their deaths on the frontlines—Hello? Can you hear me? While you're out there, watch out for an ambush.

attributes.content: So as a thank-you, how about I invite you to watch the Catastrophe cloud with me? You're here to 'explore', right?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Hahaha... I'd really rather not. I'm shaking in my boots here.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Alright. Your loss. Now scram. If any clueless Sarkaz grabs you again, just tell them who let you go—Wiš'adel.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You have my thanks.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: That sure was a close call. If you hadn't rescued me, this journey would have been my last.
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.content: Drop the act around me. I know you got caught on purpose.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: It's so weird. Why do I keep running into people who have nothing to do with the Sarkaz, but want to help anyway?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: The Liberi eyes the seemingly relaxed Sarkaz before him, quickly realizing she's likely the leader of the group—and that her attention has long since shifted away from him.
She is focused on the distant horizon. She is heeding his warning.
The wind brings with it the sounds of the land... or maybe the rumbling of ships' engines.
Conflicts, wars... the explorer has already seen too much along the way.
*sigh*...
attributes.name: Paryaqaqa

attributes.text: 'As always, we don't want to be the ones waiting for a beating.'
'All the Arts creations we sent out have been destroyed. They know we're getting closer, but I never planned on hiding anyway.'
'Some unlucky souls have to be sent to their deaths so the others can board the ship and fight. Will it be your squad or mine?'
'Follow the orders of Babel and the Military Commission—this isn't for you to decide on your own.'
'Kill every hostile you encounter. Anyone in the squad who spares an enemy or takes spoils from their comrades—kill them too.'
'Prepare the explosives. Set up altars along the route.'
'Normally, the altars' Arts can't penetrate the armor of high-speed battleships. But this time, we have the Catastrophe cloud on our side.'

attributes.content: They're here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I knew going home wouldn't be that easy.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The earth is shaking.
The high-speed battleships slowly emerge from the shadows, blocking the Sarkaz's path forward.
The warrior launched a few charges like this while in Londinium, and considers himself one of the fortunate few.
He also knows full well that the path back to Kazdel is not a road, but a battlefield, full of corpses and awash in blood.
The Sarkaz procession stops at the edge of the firing range of the battleships' cannons.
The sky grows dark, as the black cloud overhead lets loose with rolling thunder. Their enemy is approaching.
Everyone, commence preparations like you were ordered.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Each of you just do your own job.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I don't want to catch any idiots of you showing off—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.text: 'Halt.'
'You may not advance any further.'

attributes.content: Only a few Sarkaz have noticed the young Cautus girl within their ranks.
She marches towards the head of the line.
Then, with a wave of her staff, the girl draws a line behind where she stands. The black line spreads across the earth.
A black wall rises up where the line once was.
An impregnable wall, woven of black silk threads, separates the two opposing forces.
The Sarkaz can no longer see the Cautus girl on the other side of the wall.
But one thing remains imprinted in their memories—the black crown floating above her head.
The King of Sarkaz.
Their king has not abandoned them? They have a new king?
But... why an outblood king?
The new king's voice resonates in the minds of every Sarkaz present. Meanwhile, the fleet sent to block them clearly hears her words:
The Sarkaz are going home.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I will not rule out violence if necessary. I know full well the weight of this Black Crown.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa has already led the myriad souls away. For the first time, the Sarkaz have a choice.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I will not let her efforts be in vain.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Nor do I want the Sarkaz, or any of you, to start another war.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The cycle of hatred and revenge must end.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This is the first time Amiya has openly revealed her identity since Theresa taught her all there was to know about the Black Crown inside the Assimilated Universe.
Now she can hear noisy cries from amidst the Sarkaz.

attributes.text: 'Impossible! It can't be!'
'An outblood stole the Sarkaz's crown? How?! Why?!'
'She is our king? Do I have to make a tribute? What does she want from us?'
'Let's go! It's onto the next battlefield!'

attributes.content: Terror, suspicion, reverence, ecstasy. A wave of emotions floods Amiya's mind.
In the past, she has made several attempts to explore the information stored within the Black Crown, but she has never gone this far.
The tide of information nearly overwhelms her. For millennia, the Sarkaz have desperately sought their 'King', chasing an elusive vision.
She tries her best to steady her thoughts and maintain the unshakable black wall.
I am no ruler, nor am I the King of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If the Sarkaz hate me for this, I will accept that.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I will show them the way forward, the path to end their suffering.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Both sides should stand down.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: There won't be any more war.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The black wall still stands, just as the Catastrophe swirls above the wilderness.
After a long stalemate, the first battleship in the fleet begins to change direction.
Great. Finally...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The wave of thoughts suddenly fade away, and she hears an unusually clear voice—

attributes.text: '...Who are you?'

attributes.content: Remain silent.
attributes.name: Apostolic Knight

attributes.content: As His Holiness commanded.
attributes.name: Apostolic Knight

attributes.content: Even though the Sarkaz have committed countless crimes within our holy city? Even though Laterano has never before faced such provocation and desecration?
attributes.name: Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Even though their army is openly threatening the safety of our residents? Even then, we will not respond?
attributes.name: Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Yes. His Holiness believes that Laterano should not interfere in this matter.
attributes.name: Apostolic Knight

attributes.content: I wish to see him. I'm going to file a protest!
attributes.name: Lateran Commando

attributes.content: ...We are unsure where he is right now.
attributes.name: Apostolic Knight

attributes.content: The sudden disturbance of the halo, and the flood of information...
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: For whatever reason, it suddenly became aware of something.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: 'A conversation'.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: It is... having a conversation. With something similar to itself.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Since it has decided to make its choice, I am afraid I must follow suit. The new revelation it has showed us is something Laterano can no longer bear on its own.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Let me think... let's start with the first question.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: ...Who are you?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.text: 'I have to admit, Your Holiness, that this is a long road.'
'Even without the whispers of the myriad souls trapped in Originium for millennia, it will still take a long time for the Sarkaz and this land to let go of their hatred.'
'Well then, Amiya, my child, what if we do not have that much time?'
'What if Terra is no longer in its infancy and has come to the point where it has to face its future—'
'Theresa warned me this might happen.'

attributes.content: Someone walks into the static void.
He is following someone else's footsteps, although their footprints have vanished from this place forever.
The tower is still collapsing, a hint at everything that has transpired.
Although time has no meaning here, he must admit that he's a step late.
She is already completely out of reach.
Now all he can see is the golden ocean and the lonely diamond in the sky.

attributes.text: 'Amiya, not even I, the pope, know when or where the disaster will occur.'
'But I am certain that it will be a crisis that we've never faced before—'
'It is right before our eyes.'
